info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 31 at 3:39PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Gaines, western Borden, northwestern Howard, northeastern Martin and Dawson Counties through 415 PM CDT... Cold air funnels have been reported across Borden and Dawson counties with these storms. These funnels do not typically reach the ground, but if they do wind speeds are similar to that of a strong dust devil. These storms are moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Public. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Lamesa, Ackerly, Gail, Welch, Lamesa Municipal Airport, Los Ybanez, Sparenberg, Punkin Center, Arvana, Hancock, Vealmoor and Key. LANDSPOUT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
